intro: Sutera luteiflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sutera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Sutera luteiflora is often found in coastal areas and moist woodlands, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates.
